Reviews.Title: “A very different stay”
Reviews.Author: Geogteacher01
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in Venice, but this time decided to give the Lido a chance. It makes your stay very different, and I don't think I'd do it again. I love Venice so much that I want to be there and feel it. I want to wake up to the sound of church bells and the traffic of canals and people going to work etc. I want to end the day walking around the narrow streets and hear my heels clicking in the night. That said, the Lido is an experience. This hotel is quietly sited and is near to the vaporetto stop without being able to hear them all night. However, during the week we were there, a party of teenagers + teachers arrived and the place took on the feel of a youth hostel. There was running in corridors, slamming doors, screeching girls and shouting out of the bedroom windows. Not really what I wanted on my holiday.This hotel is obviously proud of its Trip Advisor rating as it is displayed in reception.If they want to keep it they have to function as a hotel not a youth hostel. The staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast was fine. Retro feel of the place was amusing. It was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “very small room!”
Reviews.Author: matildathecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a standard room. Our room did not resemble any of the photographs on the website. It was tiny... just larger than the size of the double bed! To make matters worse, the available space was not used well. The bedside tables were round and as they already had lamps on, there was no room to put anything else and the wardrobe was spacious but only had about 5 hangers in and no shelves to put anything. With no drawers or space under the bed to put our cases, we were constantly tripping over things! Had I known this I would have definitely upgraded to a superior room because it wasn't much more at the time of booking. Although the bed was comfortable the pillows felt like we were sleeping on bags of cement and we couldn't seem to cool the room down. Despite it being October and quite cool outside, the only way we could cool the room down was to open the window as it was so small and stuffy and the 'air conditioning' controls did not seem to work. Plus there are air vents from each room into the corridor which meant that we could hear noises from the corridor and the other rooms near ours really clearly, so we felt like we had to whisper all the time and turn the volume on the TV down really quietly! That aside, the room was smart and clean and the bathroom was modern. The breakfast was basic but nice enough; cereal, bread, meat, cheese, yoghurt, tinned fruit. The staff were pleasant and polite and most of them spoke good English. The hotel is located in a quiet area but only about 5 mins from the vaporetto stop, which takes you straight to St Mark's Square or Burano. There are plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel too. I had read not to expect too much for Venice hotels which is why we chose to stay on the Lido. Although the room was cheaper than many in Venice itself, it was not cheap and not worth what we paid. That said, we had a fantastic holiday. Venice is a truly unique and wonderful place. The room was okay as a base but not ideal for the romantic holiday that I had planned!

Reviews.Title: “Dated but well kept and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to still have its internal fittings from the 70s but these have actually been well kept and is very clean. The reception is open 24 hours a day and there's quite a pleasant courtyard. It's not far from the vaporetto stop on a very pleasant street in Lido, quiet and full of private homes reflecting the stylish yet relaxed nature of Lido, a great escape away from the mania of the main part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rigel”
Reviews.Author: johnbelle56
Reviews.Content: Very goodl, friendly staff, good breakfast. Quiet street, close to waterbus link to other parts of Venice. We would stay here again. Much more peaceful than main Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shamborovsky
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, especially superior rooms are strictly advised!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhillyMLE
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rigel is a good option for travelers who are looking to save a little while in Venice and don't mind traveling to and from Lido Island each day. I actually liked having to get on the vaporetto every morning to see the sights of Venice as the views from the water are quite good. The hotel desk staff are all very friendly and speak English well. We had a superior double room, though I'm not sure what was so superior about it! It was perfectly adequate with a spacious bathroom and small balcony though the view was of another building. The hotel is well located to the vaporetto station, and the breakfast buffet offers good variety to start your day. As others have mentioned, the walls are absurdly thin, so you do hear people talking, toilets flushing, etc. Fortunately no one was obnoxiously loud when we were there. The hotel offers limited parking for 5 euros per day. We had requested it but arrived too late in the day to actually get a spot, so be aware that it's not guaranteed. Fortunately we found free parking a few blocks away and were able to leave the car there for three days! So it actually worked to our advantage to have not gotten a spot at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: travelfanBern
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here on the Lido during our trip to Venice. Nice location, staff very friendly, the room was quite spacious (superior room), unfortunately no minibar to cool drinking water, no in-room safe. The restaurant possibilities in the near vicinity are limited and quite pricey but this is ,after all, Venice! Breakfast was O.K. we were able to choose from Cappucino,Latte Macchiato etc. which is not always the case in hotels. A tip though, try and avoid weekends! Although a fairly small hotel, they cater for coach tours and we were unfortunately there from Sat-Sun at the same time as a group of students from Austria and another group from America. They naturally wanted to enjoy themselves and it was far from peaceful! Otherwise I think the sound-proofing is bearable! For a quick and relaxing getaway from throbbing Venice the Lido is worth a visit, but don't book for too long!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ellejay22
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel located just off the main lido road, only a short 5 minute walk to the water bus station and a 10 minute water bus ride to the center of venice. Tickets for the water bus (vaporetto) only cost us 33 euros for 72 hours and its well worth the money as you can jump on and off the buses and travel round the islands as often as you want. Make sure you visit the glass making island of murano and the really pretty island of burano (google it!) which has all the houses painted different colours. We also visited the island of Torcello but there wasnt much there apart from deserted fields and farms and an old church so if your in a rush give it a miss! Venice is exactly how you imagine it, canals everywhere lots of little (expensive) shops and restaurants. If you go on a gondula make sure you insist on paying upfront otherwise once your sat in the boat they will double the price and rip you off! If we go to venice again would definitely stay at the hotel Rigel, the staff are really friendly and helpfull. Its nice to get away from overcrowded venice onto the smaller, calmer safe island of the lido and the restaurants are much better value for money!

Reviews.Title: “great ambience”
Reviews.Author: sillebellis
Reviews.Content: Very attractive and quiet location on the Lido. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. Very Clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a Good Price in a Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: metrocoyote
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 30-35 minute boat ride from St Mark's Square but the savings in price more than makes up for the commute. The hotel staff was kind, though some people did not speak/understand English very well, so brush up on your Italian before you stay here. The room was small but comfortable and very charmingly decorated. The bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: natalie3005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just been to Venice for the weekend and stayed 2 nights in this delightful hotel. Located on the Lido which is a delightful little island. I must say we probably stayed in their smallest room.... but it was as much as we needed and the room was obviously newly refurbished and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was continental but sufficient. This hotel was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & good value, but basic facilities.”
Reviews.Author: A1-WeekendTraveller
Reviews.Content: Like most, Venice has always been on the list of places to visit, and a four night deal at Hotel Rigel proved to be a â€˜veryâ€™ affordable break. Located on the Lido di Venezia, a 10 minute Vaporetto ride from the main island, the hotel is set in a quiet location just off the main through road, a 5 minute walk from the Vaporetto & bus station. Check-in was straight forward & friendly; although other reception staff seemed rather officious during the stay. The room dÃ©cor was actually to a higher standard then initially expected, finished with cushioned satin fabric walls and colour coded bedding & curtains presenting an almost boutique feel. The small en-suite wet room was basic but reasonably well finished. That said, there were certain aspects (wardrobe & bathroom doorframe) that appeared well used & worn or just unfinished. The bed, while a good size & equipped with soft quality sheets & blankets, was far too hard for comfortable sleep. Admittedly, while firmness is down to personal preference (I actually donâ€™t mind firm but well sprung), this was the extreme! You could actually bounce a coin on it, no problems! As per other reviews, noise from adjacent rooms and other guests (especially during the evening & at night) is a significant problem here. Doors are often slammed closed and conversations from other guests seem to reverberate around the stairwells and hallways. Typically, most travellers go to Venice to see the sights, enjoy the ambience & hopefully get some good weather. Fresh air plus â€˜lotsâ€™ of walking equals sleep. However, my sleep was all too frequently interrupted by the noise level. So be warned! Unfortunately, the rooms have do not have tea or coffee facilities, so no refreshments unless you buy them yourself. However, there is a Billa supermarket just round the corner with all regular priced products. Nor is there an iron in the room (or hotel for that matter), so those travelling light will have to make do with some creases. Again, as mentioned by others, the offerings presented at breakfast are woefully inadequate. Rest assured, I state this not hoping for a full cooked breakfast, but having travelled extensively through many other European countries, there are minimum expectations! A single croissant and bread roll were waiter served (per guest) when seated, with the rolls being so stale they resembled rocks! All other food offerings were presented on a trite and characterless buffet comprising sliced meat (just 2 types), sliced cheese (cheddar only), hard boiled eggs, tinned peaches & pears, a couple types of dried cereal, yoghurt, some packet biscuits and a selection of teas. The so called machine dispensed fruit juice looked & tasted truly awful, worse than a budget fruit cordial. The breakfast alone really lets down the whole establishment. The only positive each morning was the different types of freshly made coffee available, again made to order. As the hotel is only B&B (promptly reminded by staff as you check-in), evenings were spent trekking round local restaurants on the main strip between the Vaporetto station and the beach. Perhaps a cross-over review, but still relevant here. I challenge you to spot any differences in the presented menus? Seriously, theyâ€™re all identical bar the price. Most of the so called authentic dishes knocked up in the Mom & Pop pseudo restaurants are for the tourist trade tasting bland & insipid. Service is often below par favouring the Italian clientele but still expecting a worthy gratuity! Best value tip is to actually opt for the fresh pizza, cheap @ 6-8E & well flavoured. For much improved dining, head back over to the main island & scout around for a decent restaurant, yes there are some! Avoid the tourist traps, donâ€™t pay over the odds & youâ€™ll find some great food & genuinely friendly service. Try CaffÃ© Ristorante Canel Grande by the Rialto Bridge for the fresh lobster, highly recommended. Overall impression: Accommodation is comfortable with a reasonable degree of quality, certainly enough as a base to explore from. Some may say itâ€™s too far from the main city, but itâ€™s in a much quieter location and exceptional value for money despite the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm near a crowded jewel box”
Reviews.Author: BillSeldon
Reviews.Content: Venice is horribly crowded for most of the year, so the Lido offers a quiet location within easy reach of the city by vaporetto. The Rigel is an excellent budget hotel in a peaceful street in easy walking distance of the ferries or the beach. It gives excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant accomodation , superb breakfast, amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: davideparker
Reviews.Content: Th Lido is so much nicer than staying in Venice, and is a convenint centre for travel to other Islands, and the Airport. Located 5 minutes walk from the main vaporett,( water bus), stop. in a leafy side road , this 42 room hotel is a amazing value. Beautifully clean and well equipped rooms, a superb breakfast menu, and friendly staff. I defy anyone not to enjoy their stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem”
Reviews.Author: AlisonCLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one day & night when stranded by the strikes in France! The rooms are very generously sized, as are the bathrooms (you get a full-sized bath- hoorah!) and the decor is pretty if very slightly dated. The reception staff are wonderful- couldn't be more helpful, pleasant and kind. The Lido is an ideal place to stay as it's quieter and cheaper than Venice but only a short (and very pleasant) boat ride away from St Marks. The rates are incredibly reasonable so I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Spotlessly clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine27Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I'd really recommend this hotel. Its in Lido (just across the water) however with a 10 -15 minute water bus ride to St Mark's square its still ideally situated. (The waterbus stop is literally 2 mins walk away from the hotel). You get great views of Venice too coming in from Lido. Lido is a nice quiet island, less touristy than Venice with lovely cafe's and shops. - a great contrast to Venice. The water buses are very frequent and run for most of the night. The hotel is not particlarly luxurious but it is very comfortable and great value for money. Its very well maintained, in good condition throughout ,and spotless. The maid service is excellent - although we perhaps didn't need new towels every day (the towels were lovely and fluffy by the way!) The room was a good size with plenty of wardrobe space. The staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good - lots of fruit, yogurts, pastries, bread, cheese, salami. The only thing I would change would be the pillows - they were very hard!

Reviews.Title: “Great value indeed”
Reviews.Author: Nicke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Lido di Venezia, 5 minutes by foot from the ferries and 15 minutes by foot from the beach. The rooms are clean and airconditioned with a rather big bathroom with a good supply of towels etc. There were two balconies in our room. We paid 400 â‚¬ for 5 nights in our family room (4 beds) including breakfast - great value indeed! Eating breakfast in the hotel was a true pleasure, excellent service and variety. The only things we missed in our room was an ironing board and ironer but it was said that it was not possible due to fire security. Also, the WiFi internet should be free in my opinion (paid 6 â‚¬ for 3 hours) and should be possible to use in the room, not only in the lobby. Other than that, I cannot find anything bad to say about this hotel. A great find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bargain”
Reviews.Author: Dianne95
Reviews.Content: This small, quiet hotel on the Lido, a short water taxi trip away from Venice, is lovely. The rooms are not chock full of amenities, but are clean and pleasant. The breakfast is wonderful -- great bread, cold cuts, cheese, yoghurt, fruit and cereal - don't expect an American breakfast, but why would you want one in Italy? There is a lovely patio to sit upon, and this hotel is only a block away from one of the promenades, worth a stroll all by itself. The staff is helpful, and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gotorob-Travel
Reviews.Content: Well we have just returned from this hotel on Venice lido - great place to stay and the location of the hotel just off the main street. Clean hotel - great feel to the hotel. 3* and very Italian feel to it - faded elegance. Well worth a visit but try and request a balcony room - breakfast good, basic but all you need to set you up for the day - go and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rigel is actually located in Limbo!”
Reviews.Author: Primary9000
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel because the better ones were booked up due to the Venice film festival. The long and short is that i wouldnâ€™t stay here again. I could have over looked some of the bad points if it were cheaper but in the end your paying for the location with this one as its only five minutes to the locally shops etc and the bus boats into Venice. Upstairs it reminded me of the hotel in the shining! The decor in the rooms was old fashioned and the whole place looked grubby. My room was dark, the AC didnâ€™t work very well and no in-room safe. Breakfast was very poor the cereals tasted like cardboard.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: shell12London
Reviews.Content: I and my husband have stayed there twice. The first time we stayed there in 2006 with my son, it was a pleasent hotel albeit with a very basic breakfast but hey we were in Italy! and if you wanted you could eat it outside and because we are smokers it was perfect for us as we could enjoy a cuppa with a ciggerette, (you smokers will understand what I mean!) and if you wanted more coffee you could have it. the staff that were there then were lovely, it had a bar downstairs and the staff would serve you drinks whenever you wanted one. fast forward to 2008 and what a change.. the room we had was OK, the breakfast was the same, however, It was as if we were being rationed i.e. if you asked for more well the looks you got.. and as for having your breakfast outside forget it despite it being glourious weather.. that meant that they had to put the cushions on the chairs and the table cloths on the tables so no chance.. fair enough we let that go, however if you have been to Lido then you would know there really isn't a lot to do there on a night time if you don't want to catch the boat into Venice itself except relax and enjoy your surrounds, and what better way then to have a drink.. at your hotel, unlike last time, this time NO WAY.. the bar was never open, infact one of the nicer staff told us to go and buy a bottle of wine and gave us the glasses to drink out of! and do not get me started on the American School Parties.. that were coming and going all night. this hotel has gone down badly. I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, poor service, late night disturbances, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: frogcurry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible, and has so many things wrong with it that its almost the Italian Fawlty Towers. I dread to think what the poorer hotels in Venice must be like. Why it has a good rating on this website I can't imagine. The issues I had included the following: - a poorly maintained bathroom with an electrical fitting hanging loose and wires visible - corridors that look like a prison, with horrible dated decor throughout the hotel - a poor breakfast made of cheap food (such as the Tesco Value-style cornflakes) - late arrivals checking in at 1 - 2am most days stayed there, often making a huge amount of noise. The walls are cardboard thick and so are the doors, plus the corridors echo and amplify any sounds. - noisy rattling air conditioning at any speed, and sounding like it was about to break at top speed. - No safes in the rooms to store your valuables in. - Poor cleanliness of the towels and the bedsheets (not being washed thoroughly enoughed).

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fifimcfifi
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable, clean with air conditioning and small balcony. Breakfast was basic but adequate. Very helpful and knowledgeable receptionists Great location in quiet, residential road just a few minutes walk to restaurants, bars and vaparetto stop. Public beach is around 5 minutes walk and very clean with good facilities. All in all, a very enjoyable stay here WORD OF WARNING: Lido is just as expensive as Venice - most Lido restaurants charge a 1.5 Euro cover charge per person plus 10% service charge. In contrast, many Venice restaurants display signs stating "No cover charge or service charge". The few souvenir/gift shops opertating on Lido are very expensive with little choice. Venice has 100's of souvenir shops and prices are much lower than Lido. Expect to pay 1.20 - 1.50 Euros for a small bottle of 500ml water from street vendors on Lido and Venice and up to 2.50 Euros in Lido street cafes for a 500ml bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “we got less than promised”
Reviews.Author: julka-pulka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet, ca. 5 min walk from the Lido farry. But do not go with your car there: although the parking place is promised on the web-page there is no parking possible (only in the gateway of hotel, but its not what you really want). The business/internet room was also promised on the web-page of the hotel, but it was out of order, and nobody could say when it will be fixed. The breakfast is poor, one day we got eggs but no chees, another day cheese and no eggs, bred pieces are counted, you need to ask every time for another one.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Rigel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Enrico Dandolo, 13, 30126 Venice, Italy
